License Definitions

By downloading and installing this sample, you hereby agree that the accompanying Materials are being provided to you under the terms and conditions of the End User License Agreement for the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives product previously accepted by you. Please refer to the file ippEULA.rtf located in the root directory of your Intel ® IPP product installation for more information. 

The G.168, G.167, G.711, G.722, G.722.1, G.722.2, AMRWB, Extended AMRWB (AMRWB+), G.723.1, G.726, G.728, G.729, G.729.1, iLBC , GSM AMR, GSM FR, Microsoft Real-Time Audio are international standards promoted by ITU ( http://www.itu.int ), ETSI ( http://www.etsi.org ), 3GPP ( http://www.3gpp.org ), GIPS ( http://www.ilbcfreeware.org ) and other organizations. Implementations of these standards, or the standard enabled platforms may require licenses from various entities, including Intel Corporation.

Overview

This package contains the echo canceller sample (./application/ usc_ec ), noise reduction and voice activity detector sample (./application/ usc_nr ), speech codec sample (./application/ usc_speech_codec ), the tone detector sample (./application/ usc_tones ) and the UMC Speech RTP Codec Sample (./application/ umc_speech_rtp_codec ).

The speech codec sample supports encoding and decoding compliant to the 3GPP TS 26 071, 073,  171, 173, 174, 190-194, 273, 274, 290, ITU-T G.711/I/II, G.722, G.722.1, G.723.1/A, G.726/A, G.728G//I/J/H, G.729/A/B/D/E/I/C/C+, G.729.1 recommendations, ETSI GSM 06.90-06.94, 06.10-06.12, 06.31-06.32 recommendations, Microsoft Real-Time Audio.

The tone detection algorithm complies with ITU G.168-2002 specifications.

The echo cancellation sample complies to the ITU-T G.168-2000 and G.167 recommendations. 

The samples have been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions. They are command line based applications which process data given by one or more input PCM files and store the result into output bitstreams or PCM files. Both narrow band (8000 Hz)   and wide band (16000 KHz) are supported.  

For more information refer to the specific sample readme.htm file.  

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/.

System Requirements

Recommended hardware:
  • A system based on the Intel® Pentium® 4 processor with 128 megabytes of RAM or better
  • A system based on Intel® Core(TM) 2 Duo processor with Intel® Extended Memory 64 Technology (Intel® EM64T)
Hardware requirements:
  • A system based on a Intel® Pentium® processor, Intel® Xeon® processor, or subsequent IA-32 processor
  • A system based on a processor with Intel® Extended Memory 64 Technology (Intel® EM64T)
Software requirements:
  • Intel® IPP 6.1 for Windows*
  • Intel® C++ Compiler for Windows*: version 10.1, 11.0, or 11.1
  • Intel® Parallel Composer
  • Microsoft* Visual C++* 2003, Microsoft* Visual C++* 2005, Microsoft* Visual C++* 2008
  • Windows* Server 2003, Windows* XP, Windows* Vista, Windows* 7, Windows* Server 2008 or Windows* Server 2008 R2
  • For an system based on a processor with Intel® Extended Memory 64 Technology (Intel® EM64T):
    Microsoft* Platform SDK for Windows* Server 2003 SP1 for EM64T platform

Package Contents

The speech codec package contains the following files:

./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs

readme.htm

This file

build32.bat, build64.bat, buildem64t.bat

Platform specific tools to build the samples

makefile

Platform specific make file for build tools

ippEULA.rtf

End User License Agreement

uscmanual.pdf

Unified Speech Component Interface Reference Manual

support.txt

Contains information for technical support

./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs/application

This folder contains 5 implementations of applications

1) usc_ec :  ITU G168 and G167 compliant implementation for Echo Canceller (EC) Sample
2) usc_nr :  USC base Noise Reduction and Voice Activity Detector implementation
3) usc_speech_codec : USC base speech coding implementation
4) usc_tones : ITU G168 compliant implementation for Tone Detector Sample

5) umc_speech_rtp_codec : UMC based RTP packetization/depacketization Sample

./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs/lib/win32

ipp_rta.lib

Library with Microsoft RT Audio API support for Windows* OS for IA-32 architecture

./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs/lib/win64

ipp_rta.lib

Library with Microsoft RT Audio API support for Windows* OS for IA-64 architecture

./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs/lib/winem64t

ipp_rta.lib

Library with Microsoft RT Audio API support for Windows* OS for Intel ® 64 architecture

Installation

Extract all files in w_ipp -sample_*.zip to a desired folder. Please make sure to preserve the directory structure. The files for the USC Speech Codec, USC Echo Cancellation, USC Filter, UMC Speech RTP codec and USC tones samples will be found in the ./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs folder.

How to Build Source Code

  • Set up your build environment by creating an environment variable named IPPROOT that points to the root directory of your Intel ® IPP installation. For example: IPPROOT=C:/Program Files/Intel/IPP/6.1.x.xxx/ia32/
    • To build for an IA-32 system: run build32.bat.
    • To build for an system based on a processor with Intel® Extended Memory 64 Technology (Intel® EM64T): run buildem64t.bat.

To build all application is to simply run build*.bat located under directory ./ ipp_samples/speech-codecs if the target system is based on Intel®Pentium®Processor system. The build*.bat will build the USC speech codec library and five samples, namely the unified echo canceller and the unified speech codec, noise reduction, tone detector, UMC speech RTP codec (for IA-32 only) . If build is successful all relevant . obj files and .lib files are created and stored under directory ./ipp_samples/speech-codecs/bin/ia32/obj/* and  ./ipp_samples/speech-codecs/bin/ia32/lib/* respectively. The .exe files will be placed in ./ipp_samples/speech-codecs/bin/ia32.

Note, with default settings it will build the sample with Intel C++ compiler. To change defaults see the Makefile for a brief description of the available variables and additional options.

Running the Software

Read the specific sample readme.htm file to learn how to build and run the sample (to locate see the table above).   

In order to run each executable created by this sample, the Intel®IPP DLLs must be on the system's path. DLLs are located in the bin subdirectory of the root directory of the Intel®IPP installation (IPPROOT). This can be done by setting the PATH environment variable manually or invoking the batch file: "%IPPROOT%/tools/ env/ippenv.bat " from the Intel®IPP installation.  

Known Limitations

There is no known limitation.

Technical Support and Feedback

To receive support or provide feedback for speech coding sample, please refer to the "Technical Support and Feedback" section of the release notes ( ReleaseNotes.htm ) provided in the Intel ® IPP product installation.

Your feedback on the Intel IPP samples is very important to us and your input will be considered for future releases. The Intel IPP sample code is intended only as an example of how to use the APIs to implement algorithms in different development environments. Please submit problems with installation, compiling, linking, runtime errors or incorrect output to Intel®Premier Support .

You can also share and discuss the experience of IPP sample usage with other developers at Intel Software Developer Forum .
